cz.agents.alite.vis.layer.common
Class CommonLayer

java.lang.Object
  cz.agents.alite.vis.layer.AbstractLayer
      cz.agents.alite.vis.layer.common.CommonLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
VisLayer
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColorLayer
public abstract class CommonLayer
extends AbstractLayer

A CommonLayer is typically a wrapper or composition of several TerminalLayers. Each non-terminal layer, should be a CommonLayer. The common layers typically have various create() factory methods, to cover the needs of the layer users. The create() method(s) of a common layer typically do not return a object of the type the particular layer, but rather a toggle layer, which turns on and off the layer e.g., by a key. For example, the create() method of the FpsLayer do not return new FpsLayer(...), but a new instance of the KeyToggleLayer, that shows the layer by pressing the 'f' key.

Author:
Antonin Komenda
